original_solution_mapping.L1: His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250.00 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125.00>>125.00
original_solution_mapping.L3: He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1200 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1200 = $<<2500-1200=1300.00>>1300.00
original_solution_mapping.L4: He wants to put half of $1300 into a retirement account so he will invest 1300/2= $<<1300/2=650>>650 into his retirement account
original_solution_mapping.L5: He had 1300 and puts $650 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 1300-650 = $<<1300-650=650>>650 remaining

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6417.
    Returns: the amount of money Harold will have remaining.
    """
    # L1
    car_payment_for_utilities_calc = 250.00 # car payment amount used for utilities calculation in solution
    utilities_fraction_divisor = 2 # 1/2 the amount of his car payment
    utilities_cost = car_payment_for_utilities_calc / utilities_fraction_divisor

    # L2
    rent_cost_in_solution = 775.00 # rent cost used in solution
    car_payment_cost_in_solution = 250.00 # car payment cost used in solution
    groceries_cost = 50.00 # $50.00 on groceries
    total_bills_cost = rent_cost_in_solution + car_payment_cost_in_solution + utilities_cost + groceries_cost

    # L3
    monthly_income = 2500.00 # $2500.00 a month from his job
    money_after_bills = monthly_income - total_bills_cost

    # L4
    retirement_fraction_divisor = 2 # half of the remaining money
    retirement_investment = money_after_bills / retirement_fraction_divisor

    # L5
    money_remaining = money_after_bills - retirement_investment

    # FA
    answer = money_remaining
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his ${car_payment_for_utilities_calc} car payment so his utilities cost {car_payment_for_utilities_calc}/{utilities_fraction_divisor} = $<<{car_payment_for_utilities_calc}/{utilities_fraction_divisor}={utilities_cost}>>{utilities_cost}

All total, his bills cost him {rent_cost_in_solution}+{car_payment_cost_in_solution}+{utilities_cost}+{groceries_cost} = $<<{rent_cost_in_solution}+{car_payment_cost_in_solution}+{utilities_cost}+{groceries_cost}={total_bills_cost}>>{total_bills_cost}

He makes ${monthly_income} a month and his bills cost ${total_bills_cost} a month so that leaves him with {monthly_income}-{total_bills_cost} = $<<{monthly_income}-{total_bills_cost}={money_after_bills}>>{money_after_bills}

He wants to put half of ${money_after_bills} into a retirement account so he will invest {money_after_bills}/{retirement_fraction_divisor}= $<<{money_after_bills}/{retirement_fraction_divisor}={retirement_investment}>>{retirement_investment} into his retirement account

He had {money_after_bills} and puts ${retirement_investment} into his retirement account so that leaves him with {money_after_bills}-{retirement_investment} = $<<{money_after_bills}-{retirement_investment}={money_remaining}>>{money_remaining} remaining

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1200 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1200 = $<<2500-1200=1300>>1300
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He wants to put half of $1300 into a retirement account so he will invest 1300/2= $<<1300/2=650>>650 into his retirement account
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: He had 2500 and puts $650 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 2500-650 = $<<2500-650=1850>>1850 remaining

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'monthly_income' (value: 2500.0) was used instead of 'money_after_bills' (value: 1300.0).
